trial_identification.studytitle: Treatment of periimplant diseases in humans. Treatment of periimplant mucositis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised placebo controlled study to evaluate the effects of chlorhexidine in the treatment of periimplant mucositis assessing the outcome variables probing depth reduction and reduction in bleeding on probing.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Double blind, placebo controlled clinical trial for treatment of periimplant mucositis using mechanical plaque control in combination with Chlorhexidine gel. A pea-sized amount of Chlorhexidine gel (0.2% of 1mg) is applied with a soft toothbrush to the affected implant twice a day for 4 weeks. Reevaluation at 1 & 3 months
interventions.comparator: A pea-sized amount of placebo is applied with a soft toothbrush to the affected implant twice a day for 4 weeks. Reevaluation at 1 & 3 months

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: At least 1 dental implant with periimplant mucositis.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Uncontrolled diabetes subjects requiring prophylactic antibiotics.

trial_design.concealment: Central registrar. Code broken once study is completed and data is locked
trial_design.sequence: computer generated random allocation with subjects allocated to equal size treatment groups
trial_design.designfeatures: subjects, therapists and outcome assesors will be blinded

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The University of Western Australia, CRROH

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the treatment of periimplant infection (mucositis) with a follow up period of 3 months. Treatment will begin with professional mechanical cleaning around the implant in addition to home tooth-brushing twice daily for 4 weeks with antiseptic (chlorhexidine) gel or placebo gel. The placebo gel will be of the same appearance as the chlorhexidine gel. The gels will be in identical tubes with identical labelling except for individual subjects study numbers.
